Place the tip of your finger on the back camera and the flash, completely covering them.
Apply gentle pressure in order to stabilize the finger.
If the smartphone is too large to hold it in one hand comfortably, use one hand to hold the phone and the other to take the reading.
Sit down if possible and keep your arm at roughly the same level as the chest.
Do not move or talk. Please follow all instructions for accurate results.
Please relax and stay still. Do not move or talk.
Breath as you usually do. Do not take very deep breaths.
Maintain slight pressure on the camera with your finger.
If the dynamic graph is very noisy, please calm down and try again.
Intealth assesses your Heart Rate Variability (HRV) - the time distribution between successive heartbeats.
HRV is controlled by the Autonomic Nervous System (ANS). It quantifies the state and health of your body’s stress response.
The higher the HRV, the more relaxed your physiological state is.
With regular HRV measurements, you can keep track of how stressed you are. We recommend taking daily measurements.
Meditation and exercise have a positive effect on your mind and body, increasing your HRV.
Intealth has guided chakra meditation exercises that helps you to achieve your health and well-being goals.
1. Place the tip of your finger on the back camera and the flash, completely covering them.
2. Apply gentle pressure in order to stabilize the finger.
3. If the smartphone is too large to hold it in one hand comfortably, use one hand to hold the phone and the other to take the reading.
4. Preferably, sit down on a chair and place your arm on a table at roughly the same level as the chest.
5. Do not move or talk. Breath normally and do not take deep breaths. Make sure to follow all instructions for accurate results.
Listen to meditations and relax your mind and body
Listen to the short meditation clip

Meditation lowers the heart rate by encouraging slower and deeper breaths and prepares us for a sound sleep. Let\'s use this exercise to put our body and mind in a completely relaxed state to improve sleep quality.
Sound meditation that helps calm the mind can also lower the blood pressure. With an exercise aimed at improving the health of our heart, let\'s reach a state of \"restful alertness\".

Several studies have confirmed that meditation can reduce signs of anger and frustration. Through this exercise, let\'s learn to identify our emotions associated with rage and anger and slow down our reactions to them.
Meditation is one of the most popular ways to relieve stress. Let\'s be more mindful and build our resilience to stress with this chakra meditation aimed at easing your mind.

Research has shown a positive correlation between regular meditation and improved immune system response. Let\'s practice this chakra meditation exercise to improve our body\'s ability to ward off diseases.
Set a daily reminder to listen this meditation and sleep well

The reading suggests that your fitness level is worse than the average person of your age. DISCLAIMER: Fitness level assessment is not meant for medical purposes. It might change with every reading until a baseline is set.

The reading suggests that your fitness level is better than the average person of your age. DISCLAIMER: Fitness level assessment is not meant for medical purposes. It might change with every reading until a baseline is set.

The reading suggests that your fitness level is similar to the average person of your age. DISCLAIMER: Fitness level assessment is not meant for medical purposes. It might change with every reading until a baseline is set.

The reading suggests that your lifestyle is less active than the average person of your age. DISCLAIMER: Lifestyle assessment is not meant for medical purposes. It might change with every reading until a baseline is set.

The reading suggests that your lifestyle is more active than the average person of your age. DISCLAIMER: Lifestyle assessment is not meant for medical purposes. It might change with every reading until a baseline is set.
Insufficient pulse scans. Complete a total of 6 scans across 3 different days to set up your baseline and get detailed insights on stress.
Collect 20 HRV gems to get a detailed stress analysis report >
SDNN is the standard deviation of the heartbeat intervals in the HRV waveform. Higher value implies that your body is under less stress.
pNN50 is the percentage of successive heartbeat intervals that differ by more than 50 ms. Balanced value means your body is coping well.
RMSSD is the root mean square of successive differences between normal heartbeats. Higher value means your body is recovering well.
The waveform is only for reference. It is not intended for medical use.
You are LESS STRESSED than usual
You are MORE STRESSED than usual
